Compression.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #if !defined( COMPRESSION_H )
00002 
00003 #define COMPRESSION_H
00004 
00005 #include "types.h"
00006 
00007 // Notes on how to use these functions without getting your hands dirty:
00008 
00009 // To decompress:
00010 //
00011 // 1) call DecompressInit() with a pointer to your compressed data, and the
00012 // size of that compressed data.  DecompressInit() returns a "decompression
00013 // pointer" that you should pass to Decompress() and DecompressFini()
00014 //
00015 // 2) call Decompress() with the decompression pointer, a pointer to a
00016 // buffer for decompressed data, and the length of that buffer.  If the
00017 // buffer is not large enough to hold all of the decompressed data,
00018 // Decompress() will fill it completely, and you can call Decompress() again
00019 // to continue your decompression.  You are responsible for knowing the
00020 // size your data will be after decompression.  (The STI/STCI file format
00021 // records your original data size for you...)  Decompress() returns the
00022 // number of bytes of output.
00023 //
00024 // 3) call DecompressFini() with the decompression pointer when you're done
00025 
00026 PTR DecompressInit( BYTE * pCompressedData, UINT32 uiDataSize );
00027 UINT32 Decompress( PTR pDecompPtr, BYTE * pBuffer, UINT32 uiBufferLen );
00028 void DecompressFini( PTR pDecompPtr );
00029 
00030 // To compress:
00031 //
00032 // 1) call CompressInit() with a pointer to your uncompressed data, and the
00033 // size of that uncompressed data.  CompressInit() returns a "compression
00034 // pointer" that you should pass to Compress() and CompressFini()
00035 //
00036 // 2) call Compress() with the compression pointer, a pointer to a
00037 // buffer for compressed data, and the length of that buffer.  If the
00038 // buffer is not large enough to hold all of the compressed data,
00039 // Compress() will fill it completely, and you can call Compress() again
00040 // with a new or emptied buffer to continue your compression later.  You 
00041 // can call CompressedBufferSize() to determine the largest buffer size you 
00042 // should need for a certain number of bytes.  Ccompress() returns the number 
00043 // of bytes of output.
00044 //
00045 // 3) call CompressFini() with the compression pointer when you're done
00046 
00047 UINT32 CompressedBufferSize( UINT32 uiDataSize );
00048 PTR CompressInit( BYTE * pUncompressedData, UINT32 uiDataSize );
00049 UINT32 Compress( PTR pCompPtr, BYTE * pBuffer, UINT32 uiBufferLen );
00050 void CompressFini( PTR pCompPtr );
00051 
00052 #endif
